overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains an active presence on Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, focusing on research, publications, and job opportunities in the field of computational social science and disinformation studies. His largest audience is on LinkedIn, but he leverages all platforms to share his work and engage with colleagues.

contentThemes.description: Announcements of new research papers, publications, and tool releases related to computational social science.
Posts advertising postdoc positions, research grants, and PhD student opportunities within Fabio Giglietto's research team.
Mentions of participation in conferences and events related to disinformation and computational methods.

recommendations: Increase cross-platform promotion of content to leverage audience overlap.
Experiment with different content formats (e.g., videos, infographics) to boost engagement.
Actively participate in conversations and respond to comments to foster community interaction.
Use more specific hashtags related to computational social science to increase discoverability.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky is used to share publications, conference presentations, and PhD opportunities. Reposts are a key engagement metric on this platform, indicating the content is being shared within the network.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon is used to announce tool releases and discuss methodological approaches. Engagement is lower compared to other platforms.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn drives the most engagement, driven by professional announcements like grant awards and job postings. Comments are present, which provides more meaningful interaction.

topPerformingContent.content: Excited to announce that our research team has been awarded a new grant to study information operations across social media platforms.
